intro: Oreocarya shantzii, commonly known as the Shantz's oreocarya, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, dry conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it blooms during the spring and early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
